data.meta_description: It is pointed out that an accurate experimental determination of the ratio $r$ of the structure-dependent axial-vector to the vector contribution in $\ensuremath{\pi}\ensuremath{\rightarrow}l\ensuremath{\nu}\ensuremath{\gamma}$ decay can settle the question of subtraction in the dispersion relation for the relevant amplitude which determines the axial-vector contribution in this decay, as well as in the electromagnetic form factor of the pion. Further, it is shown that the value of $r$ is sensitive to the value of the parameter $\ensuremath{\gamma}$ which enters into the ${A}_{1}\ensuremath{-}\ensuremath{\rho}\ensuremath{-}\ensuremath{\pi}$ system for theoretical determination of the ${A}_{1}\ensuremath{\rightarrow}\ensuremath{\rho}\ensuremath{\pi}$ and $\ensuremath{\rho}\ensuremath{\rightarrow}2\ensuremath{\pi}$ widths.
data.text:
It is pointed out that an accurate experimental determination of the ratio r of the structure-dependent axial-vector to the vector contribution in π→lνγ decay can settle the question of subtraction in the dispersion relation for the relevant amplitude which determines the axial-vector contribution in this decay, as well as in the electromagnetic form factor of the pion. Further, it is shown that the value of r is sensitive to the value of the parameter γ which enters into the A1−ρ−π system for theoretical determination of the A1→ρπ and ρ→2π widths.

DOI:https://doi.org/10.1103/PhysRev.171.1428
